0.description: The shape appears as an L where the long arm forms a horizontal line at the bottom (row 1) and the short arm is a single block on the top right (row 0, column 2).

1.description: Rotated 90° clockwise, the LBlock forms a vertical line in the center with an extra block attached at the bottom right (row 2, column 2), creating the L's foot.

2.description: In the 180° rotation, the horizontal bar is on the middle row and the additional block is on the bottom left (row 2, column 0), mirroring the original L orientation.

3.description: Rotated 270° clockwise, the LBlock displays a vertical line with the extra block attached at the top left (row 0, column 0), forming an inverted L shape.

0.description: The JBlock in rotation 0 features a horizontal bar with a protruding block on the top left (row 0, column 0), resembling the letter J.

1.description: Rotated 90° clockwise, the JBlock forms a vertical line in the center with an extra block on the top right (row 0, column 2), capturing the J shape from a rotated perspective.

2.description: At 180° rotation, the horizontal bar remains while the extra block shifts to the bottom right (row 2, column 2), inverting the original J orientation.

3.description: Rotated 270° clockwise, the JBlock displays a vertical line with an additional block on the bottom left (row 2, column 0), forming the J shape rotated in the opposite direction.

0.description: In rotation 0, the IBlock appears as a horizontal line across the second row, occupying four consecutive cells.

1.description: Rotated 90° clockwise, the IBlock forms a vertical line in the third column, with four cells aligned vertically.

2.description: At 180° rotation, the IBlock forms a horizontal line along the third row, maintaining its four-cell alignment.

3.description: Rotated 270° clockwise, the IBlock displays as a vertical line in the second column, with four cells aligned vertically.

0.description: The OBlock is a simple 2x2 square that remains unchanged regardless of rotation.
Rotation 0 of the SBlock is oriented horizontally with a zigzag pattern: two blocks at the top right and two blocks in the middle row shifted left.

1.description: Rotated 90° clockwise, the SBlock becomes vertical, featuring a block in the middle and a diagonal that extends toward the bottom right.

2.description: In the 180° rotation, the SBlock mirrors its original state with the zigzag pattern reversed, shifting the filled cells to the opposite diagonal.

3.description: Rotated 270° clockwise, the SBlock forms a vertical layout with the diagonal oriented opposite to rotation 1, creating a mirror image of the zigzag.

0.description: Rotation 0 of the TBlock shows the classic T shape, with a horizontal bar (row 1) and a centered block on top (row 0, column 1).

1.description: Rotated 90° clockwise, the TBlock appears as a vertical column with an extra block on the right (row 1, column 2), preserving its T formation.

2.description: At 180° rotation, the TBlock is inverted with the horizontal bar remaining in the middle and the extra block now positioned below the center (row 2, column 1).

3.description: Rotated 270° clockwise, the TBlock forms a vertical line with an extra block on the left (row 1, column 0), completing its T-shaped configuration.

0.description: Rotation 0 of the ZBlock presents the classic Z shape: two adjacent blocks in the top row followed by two blocks in the middle row shifted right.

1.description: Rotated 90° clockwise, the ZBlock forms a vertical layout with the top block positioned on the right and a descending diagonal structure.

2.description: In the 180° rotation, the ZBlock mirrors its original orientation with the diagonal offset reversed so that the filled cells swap sides.

3.description: Rotated 270° clockwise, the ZBlock displays a vertical zigzag with the extra block on the bottom left, reversing the diagonal seen in rotation 1.
